checks.detail: Δν≈2.084e-23 Hz < 1.0e-09 Hz (He-3 benchmark not measurable under current assumptions; see torsion_observable_designer for measurable regimes)

spec.determinism: Deterministic given the declared benchmark constants.
gaps: This uses a toy source model and an effective coupling scale assumption; publication-grade requires deriving the torsion response from the microscopic action and connecting to a concrete experimental observable/model.
inputs: TFPT scale M from constants (R^2 scale)
minimal coupling mapping constant k=3/4 (torsion bounds reference)
spec.name: Torsion observable: spin fluid (He-3 lab benchmark; assumption-explicit)
objective: Provide the requested torsion lab-test observable as a concrete, auditable calculation.
Make the coupling-scale assumption explicit (TFPT M as effective torsion scale).
outputs: predicted axial torsion amplitude |S| from a minimal spin-fluid source model
predicted SME-style |b| and an order-of-magnitude Larmor splitting Δν (Hz)
spec.question: What torsion-induced spin-precession scale does TFPT predict for a realistic spin-polarized lab medium (He-3 benchmark) under explicit assumptions?
validation: Computes a deterministic Δν for a declared He-3-like benchmark.
Marks measurability as WARN/FAIL depending on mode (this is a design-phase module).
